From:

Suilect: RE: Epstein OIG/FRI--Document Preservation 
wrote: 
the more formal lit hold form that he 
In connection with the below, as one of the prosecutors on the case, I  do have emails pertinent to Mr. Epstein's 
conditions of confinement, both in connection with the incident of July 23, 2019 (and email communications following 
up on, and seeking additional information about, that initial incident) and in connection with his apparent suicide on 
August 10, 2019. I  do not believe I  have any handwritten notes or texts that are pertinent to his conditions of 
confinement. 
Please let me know if any additional action is required. 
thank you, 
From: 
Sent: Monday, August 12, 2019 11:43 
EFTA00027098

All —  Please see below and follow instructions. Additionally, if you believe there are others at SDNY to whom this 
email should be sent, please let me know immediately. 
Thanks, 
M 
From: 
Sent: Monday, August 12, 2019 11:35 AM 
Subject: Epstein OIG/FM—Document Preservation 
Please forward this to everyone who might have any documents relating to the Epstein suicide, and cc me: 
Please make sure to preserve any documents you may have relating to Epstein's conditions of confinement. 
• Your emails will be adequately preserved, for present purposes, by the regular three-year backup. But 
let me know if you have any or not. 
• If you have any hard-copy notes, please scan them and send them to me. If you have none, let me know 
that too. 
• Most particularly, please check to see if you have texted anything pertinent. If so let me know, one 
way or the other. If you do have anything, we'll figure out how to preserve that. 
Associate U.S. Attorney 
United States Attorney's Office 
Southern District of New York 
New York. NY 10007 
EFTA00027099
